message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the broadcast problem in wireless networks, which is a common topic in the computer networks and communications (cs.NI) sub-category. The focus on energy efficiency and limited energy resources suggests that the paper may also belong to the distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The use of randomized algorithms and analysis techniques suggests that the paper may also belong to the information theory (cs.IT) sub-category. The consideration of unknown network topology and signal collisions suggests that the paper may also belong to the systems and control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the use of lower bounds and algorithmic analysis suggests that the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category.
